title: Discourse Interaction-Based Instructional Design to Bridge Inductive-Deductive Reasoning Gaps

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Learners analyze inductive-deductive reasoning gap issues occurring in elementary mathematics education settings through real cases and design solutions using discourse interaction strategies in a project-based format

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish between mathematical discourse types (specific numbers vs. pattern-based) and explain the rules of each discourse.
Learners can recognize the limitations of inductive reasoning through concrete examples and specify strategies for transitioning to deductive thinking.
Learners can develop instructional designs to address the gap in inductive-deductive reasoning among elementary learners through project-based activities.

resources: Video Recording Equipment for Interaction Analysis

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
